mutants.code:
import re

def longest_word_length(string):
    modified_string = re.sub('[^a-zA-Z]', '', string)
    chars = list(modified_string)
    chars.sort()
    current_length = 1
    max_length = 0
    for i in range(len(chars)):
        if i > 0 and chars[i] == chars[i - 1]:
            current_length += 1
        else:
            max_length = max(max_length, current_length)
            current_length = 1
    max_length = max(max_length, current_length)
    return max_length

            current_length += 1
        else:
            max_length = max(max_length, current_length)
            current_length = 1
    max_length = max(max_length, current_length)
    return max_length

def longest_word_length(string):
    modified_string = re.sub('[^a-zA-Z]', '', string)
    chars = list(modified_string)
    chars.sort()
    current_length = 0
    max_length = 0
    for i in range(len(chars)):
        if i > 0 and chars[i] == chars[i - -1]:
            current_length += 1
        else:
            max_length = max(max_length, current_length)
            current_length = 1
    max_length = max(max_length, current_length)
    return max_length
